Topics: A statement that the study involves research
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes the nature of the THRIVE Smart study?
A) It is a commercial product trial for a new smart pill bottle.
B) It is a research study designed to improve oral chemotherapy adherence using mobile health technology.
C) It is a routine check-up program for women with breast cancer.
D) It is a survey to collect general health data from the public.

Correct answer: B) It is a research study designed to improve oral chemotherapy adherence using mobile health technology.

Topics: An explanation of the purposes of the research
Questions:
What is the primary goal of the THRIVE Smart research study?
A) To evaluate the effectiveness of a new chemotherapy drug for breast cancer; B) To assess the impact of a smart pill bottle on medication adherence in women with breast cancer; C) To provide financial assistance to women with breast cancer; D) To compare the effectiveness of text message reminders versus standard care in reducing symptoms of breast cancer.

Correct answer: B

Topics: The expected duration of the subject's participation
Questions:
How long is the THRIVE Smart study expected to last for each participant?
A) 1 month; B) 3 months; C) 6 months; D) 12 months
Correct answer: B) 3 months

Topics: Any additional costs to the subject that may result from participation in the research
Questions:
Which of the following statements is true regarding additional costs for subjects participating in the THRIVE Smart study?

A) Participants will have to pay for the smart pill bottle and text messaging services.
B) Participants will incur costs for the surveys they complete during the study.
C) Participants will not incur any additional costs for participating in the study.
D) Participants will be charged for any technical support required for the smart pill bottle.

Correct answer: C) Participants will not incur any additional costs for participating in the study.

Topics: A description of the procedures to be followed
Questions:
What will happen if you decide to participate in the THRIVE Smart study?

A) You will be asked to use a traditional pillbox for your medication.
B) You will be required to attend weekly in-person meetings at the research facility.
C) You will use a smart pill bottle to track medication adherence and may receive text message interactions.
D) You will be provided with a new experimental oral chemotherapy drug for your treatment.

Correct answer: C) You will use a smart pill bottle to track medication adherence and may receive text message interactions.

Topics: The consequences of a subject's decision to withdraw from the research and procedures for orderly termination of participation by the subject
Questions:
What will happen if you choose to withdraw from the THRIVE Smart study at any point after enrolling?
A) You will be required to pay back the compensation received for participating; B) You will be barred from future research studies at Emory University; C) You may withdraw at any time and it will not affect your future care at Emory University; D) Your medical records will be removed from the study database immediately upon withdrawal.

Correct answer: C

Topics: Identification of any procedures which are experimental
The approximate number of subjects involved in the study
Questions:
How many participants will the THRIVE Smart study aim to enroll?
A) 50 participants; B) 100 participants; C) 150 participants; D) The number of participants is not specified in the consent form.
Correct answer: D) The number of participants is not specified in the consent form.

Topics: A description of any reasonably foreseeable risks or discomforts to the subject
Questions:
Which of the following is a potential risk or discomfort associated with participating in the THRIVE Smart study?
A) Risk of allergic reactions to the medication; B) Loss of time and potential anxiety from using a smart pill bottle; C) Increased risk of cancer progression; D) Risk of physical injury from study procedures

Correct answer: B

Topics: A description of any benefits to the subject or to others which may reasonably be expected from the research
Questions:
Which of the following is a potential benefit to participants in the THRIVE Smart study?
A) Guaranteed improvement in breast cancer prognosis
B) Compensation for time and effort in the form of gift cards
C) Automatic enrollment in additional unrelated clinical trials
D) Assurance of complete anonymity of personal data in public databases

Correct answer: B) Compensation for time and effort in the form of gift cards

Topics: A disclosure of appropriate alternative procedures or courses of treatment, if any, that might be advantageous to the subject
A statement describing the extent, if any, to which confidentiality of records identifying the subject will be maintained

For research involving more than minimal risk, an explanation as to whether any compensation, and an explanation as to whether any medical treatments are available, if injury occurs and, if so, what they consist of, or where further information may be obtained
Questions:
What compensation is provided to participants for their time and effort in the THRIVE Smart study, and what happens if a participant does not complete the study?

A) Participants will receive a $20 gift card for completing the enrollment survey and a $40 gift card for completing the follow-up survey, with a total of $60 if both surveys are completed. There is no compensation if a participant does not complete the study.
B) Participants will receive a $60 gift card after completing the 3-month study period, regardless of survey completion.
C) Participants will receive a $20 gift card for completing the enrollment survey and a $40 gift card for completing the follow-up survey. Partial compensation is provided for the surveys completed if the participant does not finish the study.
D) There is no compensation provided to participants at any point during the study.

Correct answer: C) Participants will receive a $20 gift card for completing the enrollment survey and a $40 gift card for completing the follow-up survey. Partial compensation is provided for the surveys completed if the participant does not finish the study.

Topics: Research, Rights or Injury: An explanation of whom to contact for answers to pertinent questions about the research and research subjects' rights, and whom to contact in the event of a research-related injury to the subject
Questions:
If you have concerns about your rights as a research participant or wish to discuss issues related to the research, whom should you contact?
A) The Principal Investigator, Dr. Ilana Graetz; B) The Emory Institutional Review Board; C) The funding source, NRG Oncology; D) Your personal healthcare provider

Correct answer: B) The Emory Institutional Review Board

Topics: A statement that participation is voluntary, refusal to participate will involve no penalty or loss of benefits to which the subject is otherwise entitled, and the subject may discontinue participation at any time without penalty or loss of benefits, to which the subject is otherwise entitled
Questions:
What does the THRIVE Smart study consent form indicate about your participation in the research?

A) Participation in the study is mandatory and withdrawing may result in penalties.
B) Participation in the study is voluntary and you can withdraw at any time without penalty or loss of benefits.
C) Refusal to participate will result in the loss of medical benefits you are currently entitled to.
D) Withdrawing from the study will require you to pay back any compensation received.

Correct answer: B) Participation in the study is voluntary and you can withdraw at any time without penalty or loss of benefits.
